Chat

Class Checkers

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • Chat.Checkers
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Checkers
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    This panel lets two users play checkers against each other. Red always starts the game. If a player can jump an opponent's piece, then the player must jump. When a player can make no more moves, the game ends. The class has a main() routine that lets it be run as a stand-alone application.
    Version:
    May 25, 2015
    Author:
    Jessica, Nanxi, Prachi, Period: 2, Assignment: CHECKERS, Sources: David Eck
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Nested Classes

      static class  Checkers.Board
      This panel displays a 160-by-160 checkerboard pattern with a 2-pixel black border.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_PORT

        public static final int DEFAULT_PORT
        Default port to connect to on remote hosts
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Checkers

        public Checkers()
        The constructor creates the Board (which in turn creates and manages the buttons and message label), adds all the components, and sets the bounds of the components. A null layout is used. (This is the only thing that is done in the main Checkers class.)

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main routine makes it possible to run Checkers as a stand-alone application. Opens a window showing a Checkers panel; the program ends when the user closes the window.
        Parameters:
        args - null array
